POR1120C - Elementary Portuguese Languag.name: POR1120C - Elementary Portuguese Language and Civilization I

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Introduces the student to Portuguese culture through the major language skills: listening, speaking, reading, and writing. Open only to students with no experience in this language.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.text: Development of Portuguese language skills at the intermediate level.

POR1121C - Elementary Portuguese Languag.name: POR1121C - Elementary Portuguese Language and Civilization II

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Continuation of POR 1120C. The course emphasizes the four major language skills: reading, writing, listening, and speaking.

POR3140 - Accelerated Portuguese for Spe.name: POR3140 - Accelerated Portuguese for Speakers of Romance Languages

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: FRE 2201, or ITA 2201, or SPN 2201, or course equivalent.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Accelerated Portuguese for proficient speakers of Romance Languages. It is expected that students have no prior knowledge of Portuguese.

Department.title: Department
Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Develop student's skills at an advanced level, focusing substantially on speaking and listening activities.

Department.text: Department of Modern Languages and Literatures

Prerequisites.title: Prerequisites
Prerequisites.text: POR 3301 or POR 3300 or POR 3413 or C.I.

Course Description.title: Course Description
Course Description.text: Examines three historical components of the South Atlantic in terms of history, culture, and contemporary political and economic consequences as these influence Lusophone literature.
